{{Infobox NFL season | logo = | team = Washington Redskins | year = 2011 | record = 4â8 | division_place = 4th [[NFC East]] | coach = [[Mike Shanahan]]http://blogs.nfl.com/2010/01/05/shanahan-will-receive-five-year-deal-to-coach-redskins/ | owner = [[Daniel Snyder]] | stadium = [[FedEx Field]] | playoffs = TBA | pro bowlers = TBD | uniform = | next = 2012 }} The [[2011 NFL season|2011]] [[Washington Redskins]] season will be the 79th season for the team in the [[National Football League]] (NFL) and their 74th representing the [[District of Columbia]] (Washington, D.C.). Their home games will be played at [[FedEx Field]] in [[Landover, Maryland]] for the 15th consecutive year. Washington will play in the [[NFC East|Eastern]] division of the [[National Football Conference]] (NFC). The Redskins hope to improve on their [[2010 Washington Redskins season|2010]] record of 6-10. {{TOClimit|3}} ==Offseason== ===2011 NFL Draft=== {{main|2011 NFL Draft}} The Redskins finished the 2010 season with a record of 6-10 and will be picking 10th overall. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%;" |+ Washington Redskins 2011 NFL Draft selections |- ! colspan="3" | Draft order ! rowspan="2" | Player name ! rowspan="2" | Position ! rowspan="2" | Height ! rowspan="2" | Weight ! rowspan="2" | College ! rowspan="2" | Contract ! rowspan="2" | Notes |- ! '''253''' | [[Chris Neild]] | [[Defensive Tackle]] | 6'2" | 319 | West Virginia | | |} ====Transactions involving 2011 draft picks==== *The Redskins traded their first-round selection (#10 overall) to the [[Jacksonville Jaguars]] for its first-round selection (#16 overall) and a second-round selection (#49 overall). *The Redskins traded their third-round selection (#72 overall) and a [[2012 NFL Draft|2012]] conditional sixth-round selection to the [[New Orleans Saints]] in exchange for [[Tackle (American football position)|T]] [[Jammal Brown]] and a fifth-round selection (#155 overall). *The Redskins traded their fourth-round selection (#104 overall) and a [[2010 NFL Draft|2010]] second-round selection to the [[Philadelphia Eagles]] in exchange for [[Quarterback|QB]] [[Donovan McNabb]]. *The Redskins acquired a seventh-round selection in a trade that sent [[Cornerback|CB]] [[Justin Tryon]] to the [[Indianapolis Colts]]. *The Redskins received a seventh-round compensatory pick. ==Preseason== ===Schedule=== The Redskins' preseason schedule was announced on April 12, 2011. ;Top passers * WAS â [[Rex Grossman]] - 22/37, 250 yards, 1 touchdown, 1 interception * DAL â [[Tony Romo]] - 22/36, 255 yards, 0 touchdowns, 1 interception ;Top rushers * WAS â [[Tim Hightower]] - 14 rushes, 41 yards * DAL â [[Felix Jones]] - 14 rushes, 115 yards ;Top receivers * WAS â [[Santana Moss]] - 5 receptions, 70 yards * DAL â [[Dez Bryant]] - 4 receptions, 63 yards ;Top tacklers * WAS â [[Oshiomogho Atogwe|O.J. Atogwe]], [[DeAngelo Hall]] - 6 tackles * DAL â [[Gerald Sensabaugh]] - 6 tackles, 1 assist }} Coming off their home win over the Cardinals, the Redskins flew to [[Cowboys Stadium]] for a Week 3 NFC East duel with the [[Dallas Cowboys]] on Monday night. Washington threw the game's opening punch in the first quarter with a 46-yard field goal from kicker [[Graham Gano]]. The Cowboys answered with kicker [[Dan Bailey (American football)|Dan Bailey]] getting a 41-yard field goal, while the Redskins replied with Gano's 27-yard field goal. Dallas would take the lead in the second quarter as Bailey made a 27-yard and a 32-yard field goal, yet the Redskins closed out the half with Gano's 50-yard field goal. Washington began the third quarter with quarterback [[Rex Grossman]] finding running back [[Tim Hightower]] on a 1-yard touchdown pass. The Cowboys would end the third quarter with Bailey making a 41-yard field goal. Dallas regained the lead in the fourth quarter with Bailey booting a 23-yard and a 40-yard field goal. The 'Skins tried to rally, but the Cowboys' defense held on to preserve the win. With the loss, the Redskins fell to 2-1. ====Week 4: at St. Louis Rams==== {{Americanfootballbox |titlestyle= {{NFLPrimaryColor|Washington Redskins}}; {{NFLSecondaryColor|Washington Redskins}};text-align:center;
